headline: Energy Secretary Says at Least a Dozen Oil Companies Eager for Venezuela
summary: Energy Secretary Chris Wright says at least a dozen American oil companies are ready to get to work rebuilding Venezuela's oil industry, including majors and a few "wildcatters," but he also said the U.S. was not providing them security guarantees.  "You've got five big ones that are there that are going to rapidly increase their production and probably another six to a dozen that are like, hey, we're ready to go," Wright told Fox's The Sunday Briefing.  Top oil executives met President Trump at the White House on Friday, when Exxon's CEO said instability in Venezuela made the region uninvestable for the time being.

headline: Trump Signs Order to Protect Venezuelan Oil Revenue from Lawsuits
summary: The White House released an executive order signed by President Trump that declares a national emergency to protect Venezuelan oil revenue in U.S. Treasury accounts from lawsuits or creditor claims.  The funds must be protected, the order says, to prevent interference with "our critical efforts to ensure economic and political stability in Venezuela," the order reads.  "The failure of these critical efforts would jeopardize major foreign policy objectives of the United States," the White House said.
